result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.    Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or control substance except by prescriptions. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling and/or assessments deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA treatment. Take medications as prescribed. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Must not enter into or loiter near an taverns, bars and liquor stores.   No contact with the victim KL (person, property, residence or family). Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

No contact with K.L..  Must n ot enter into or loiter near any taverns, bars and liquor stores.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

Defendant Brenton R Johnson in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Atty Tran.
Pretrial Risk Assessment Report
Preliminary hearing on June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
